intro: Tetradymia longispina, commonly known as the long-spined tetradymia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and herbaceous growth habit. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Tetradymia longispina is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
